subject: flasher: Add initial project
commitMessage:
flasher: Add initial project

This adds a command line utility as well as a library for interacting
directly with flash.

Only trivial device types and files are implemented, flash operations
are not yet implemented.

Change-Id: I7e04ef20f024c29048796177b63d07f953eef9d8
Signed-off-by: William A. Kennington III <wak@google.com>

Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

William, this doesn't seem like it would go in google-misc, as it has nothing to do with googles specific implementation of openbmc.  You should probably start this by making a design doc and getting a general repo, not a google-misc specific repo.

Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> William, this doesn't seem like it would go in google-misc, as it has nothing to do with googles specific implementation of openbmc.  You should probably start this by making a design doc and getting a general repo, not a google-misc specific repo.

I hear the process of getting a repo in openbmc is very quick.
Context: https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/docs/+/46573

This is intentional, right?

Instead of Alert?
A mistake. Fixed
nit: Maybe `Func` is better?
Yeah, I don't really care either way. Changed.

should this be camelCase?

I guess that depends on the coding style that we want to follow. I think OpenBMC is camelCase.

I don't think it matters, but I just want to be consistent.
I've always assumed it was fine to have variables be snake case, but not methods or class names. Doesn't matter to me either way.

https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/cpp-style-and-conventions.md#variables

If we don't care, then we can just keep it snake_case for variables so you don't have to go through the code to change it.
